preposition.description: Surrounded by; in the company of.
examples: wild strawberries hidden among the roots of the trees

preposition.description: Being a member or members of (a larger set)
examples: snakes are among the animals most feared by humans
he was among the first 29 students enrolled

preposition.description: Occurring in or practiced by (some members of a community)
examples: a drop in tooth decay among children
this pronunciation is not popular among the general public
rooting out abuses among the clergy

preposition.description: Indicating a division, choice, or differentiation involving three or more participants.
examples: the king called the three princesses to divide his kingdom among them
choosing a privatization scheme from among five models

origin: Old English ongemang (from on in + gemang assemblage, mingling). The -st of amongst represents -s (adverbial genitive) + -t probably by association with superlatives (as in against).
